title: Just ... Shut up please
body:
I get the purpose of the Long-Move voicelines is for when youre moving from base across the map, etc., but did Ashe's VO update really need to go on and on ... and on... and on ... 

Most of these lines could be drastically shorter. 
>I have heard no better words than "The Strongmust try the Impossible." This is the oath I must fulfill." 

The same message could've been delivered by simply just saying "The Strong must try the impossible." All in all, the VO update is amazing and by far one of Riot's best VOs in a long time (Nunu being the last good one, imo, and before that you'd have to go back pretty far.) especially as it kept most if not ALL of Ashe's prior lines including her double entendre taunt - Though its no longer a general taunt and only spoken towards her husband, now. 
Do note that I'm not complaining about Ashe's VO specifically, but that many many many champions, near every single release or update since Sir Thomas Kench, are senselessly mouthy and annoying. 
I'm here to play a strategy game, not listen to random narration that has nothing to do with the game. Ever played Soul Calibur? The narration at the beginning of fights doesn't keep talking during the fight, nor would anybody want it to. 

All in all, thank you Riot for updating the voicelines of a fairly outdated champion and thank you a dozen times more for keeping her original lines (Still miss Nunu's ... everything. All of his old lines were iconic.) but please. 
PLEASE dont pack certain voicelines so much. 

Oh, and remember; 

> {{champion:20}} 
*IT'S COLD OUT THERE.*

replies.body: The narrative has _everything_ to do with the characters in the game, though. The game may not be canon anymore, but that doesn't erase the fact that these champions have their own stories and relationships.
Good point, Riot doesn't have a site dedicated to just this one game that has all the information on it if I wanted to know....
Not everyone reads the lore. In fact, most of the playerbase's lore knowledge comes from champion quotes.

They do have their own stories and friendships but that does not mean we have to hear the history of her life every time we go from base to lane!

You certainly have an uncommon opinion. You could just turn them off? Or idk better yet would be to throw out an idea to turn off all irrelevant voice lines. I doubt it would happen cause the majority of league players don't seem to have an issue with this at all. An option could be to turn off the music, and voice and only keep the SFX on. You'll be able to hear those audio cues you want without their "annoying" voice lines. You'll be missing out on what makes a character a character but hey some people just want to play a game and nothing else.

I just ... 
Dont think League is a game that needs 10-20 second monologues. 

I'm fine with the voiceovers itself, but a lot of Ashe's lines could have been much much shorter in length, often three times as wordy as they have to be to get the point across. The writing just isn't very good. And I say this *as a writer* myself.

You say that like Riot is forcing you to sit down & listen to the VO & VO alone everytime you play.

In game there are also other sounds playing. There's the bg music, announcer, numerous SFX, pings, other VO lines happening. Some people play with other songs/mucis playing in the background. Some people play with friends that talk over the VO. There's quite a few things that can drown out the champs' VO in game. I'm sure the long move VO lines won't happen often per game anyway.

It's completely different than watching a video dedicated to showing the new VO in it's entirety.

I mean ... yeah Riot is forcing me to listen to the obnoxious VOs. I dont control when they play and the only way to not be bombarded with the 5 minute monologues cuz I clicked on the minimap is to not play that skin. 

Im not saying the *ENTIRE* Voiceover is too long; it's only 9 minutes. Tahm Kench's full voiceover is 24+ for the record, and multiple skins/champions after him comment on how much he talks as a result because prior to that, 5 minute voiceovers were on the longer side. I AM saying Ashe has a ton of dialogue - on her base skin even, meaning I kind of would have to play PROJECT to not hear them - that go on and on and on for 20 seconds or so. 

and lastly; Have you ever PLAYED Xayah? Or Rakan? At all? Like even for 1 game
They literally DO NOT shut up ever. Yes, I could mute voice lines but the thing is, voice lines are a huge part of the game as they are in almost every non-turnbased game (and arguably, even some TBS games like Fire Emblem); There's a reason Xayah, for instance, shouts FEATHERS FLY every single time she presses R with no exception; why evelynn's W casts *override her current voice line and plays a new one*, etc. 
Theyre highly impactful and key to knowing what your/the enemy champion is doing. Long Move voiceovers do NOT contribute to this, theyre just a reason to not hover my champion (and thus, have less information immediately relevant to me) to not have to listen to it.
It is actively worsening my experience of the game.

>and lastly; Have you ever PLAYED Xayah? Or Rakan? At all? Like even for 1 game

Yes, I have played Rakan a few times. Yes, he & Xayah do talk a lot, especially together. But I never been bothered by it. I never been bothered by champ's VO in general. I've played Taliyah & her " Throw another rock". I've played Super Galaxy Rumble & his "SUPER INFERNO WAVE!!". I've play Rammus & his long & deep discussions on the meaning of life.
I never had a problem with the long move quotes because it allows me to learn a bit more about the champ's personality & views on the world & events.

That the thing about this subject, it's a personal problem, it's subjective. I never had a problem with the VOs because I either think it's neat, heard it a bunch of times before so I'm use to it or listening to something entirely.
But for you, it's clearly a different story. You take the gameplay side seriously & find the VO distracting when it's not gameplay dialogue.

I dont mind the little quips and jabs and shout outs.

Rakan quoting Stayin' Alive by the Beegees? Awesome. 
Kaisa spouting a novel when she respawns? Alright guess I just wont ever die.

For me, one of the enjoyable parts of a Champ is often their VO. I like Xayah and Rakan's banter as they walk back to lane, and I think they are one of the better examples of detailed VOs that deliver character done right. 

Also, you can literally mute your Champion. Riot is NOT forcing you to listen, not to mention you can adjust the VO volume higher or lower to suit your preferences. I like listening to VOs but I have it low enough to where I can tune it out easily when I am focusing on something else. There is also a reason they started doing "long move" lines. You're probably walking to lane when you hear these lines, unlikely to be doing much other than watching the map. If that is somehow worsening your experience of the game, then idk what to tell you. Its not like they are spouting these lines in the middle of battle. Its a LONG MOVE quote. 

Lastly, I don't think turning off voices turns off gameplay important voicelines does it? I haven't tried it before but I'm pretty sure things like Xayah's "feathers fly" and such don't turn off, but I could be wrong.

they do. but important abilities have distinct enough sound effects without the voice. bjerg plays without voices. you don't need them.

Yeah honestly, I was trying to think of another ability where I needed the Voice line as a cue but I literally came up with nothing. Maybe Xayah's ult and that's it. Even Lee's ult kick is really obvious visually and sfx-wise. There are even some Champions that formerly didn't have voice lines for certain abilities that now do, even though they didn't need them, like most of Morgana's abilities for example. Its just a bit of character flavor.

it does, though! it's only those quotes, too, so turning voice lines off in general isn't really going to help because I still want to hear the rest of the VOs, and most champions DONT have 45 minute spiels. Irelia and Ashe? Maybe Ezreal? 

And again, it's not that hard to compact all of the story information, all of the character and personality, into a much shorter line. 
Riot has no reason to make extra-long monologues *other than because they can*. The long quotes aren't even memorable, partly because they are so long.
I don't know how well known the terms Laconic and the quote "Brevity is the soul of wit" are, but, you can almost always cut a long winded paragraph down to a mid-length sentence if you wanted to, with some clever phrasing.

Game of Thrones could be told in 300 pages, would it make it better? Words are here to give the feel. If Ashe did not say "I have heard no better words" you wouldn't know her favourite sentence. If she didn't say it is something she must fullfill, you wouldn't know how much she cares about it. If it was in your way, It would make it her quote, not something anonymous she has heard.

It could be shorter, but it doesn't necessarily mean it would be the same, or even feel the same. So please stop bitching no sense. It is a long move quote, it is supposed to be long.

I don't agree that it's a good VO, but I _do_ agree that champions need to just shut up.  They talk so much, most of the VOs sound like them yelling at everything, and it gets tedious quickly.  I'm fine with really basic lines and such.  We don't need 20+ seconds of talking all the time.  People don't really talk like that; think how many words you say on average.

Well that might have something to do with the fact that we're not video game characters with interesting stories that overlap with the stories of others, where the only way we can tell our stories in the game is by talking constantly.

"Praise Frostbringer Anivia, Grant us safety in travel." 

"Praise The Kindred Hunters, that we may see Death's approach with our eyes open."

"My mother fought and died for me, so I will fight for [the sake of?/a better life to?] all Avarosans." 

"The Strong must try the Impossible." 

A few quotes I pulled from the first minute or so of her VO spotlight, shortened. I tried to keep every important word, maintain the feeling and cut down on the blabbing. 
The mood and interaction with other champions is still there, and its ONLY the excessively LONG lines I can't stand. If I had an easy way to copypaste the full quotes, I would, but theyre not up on the wiki yet. I'll possibly come back and edit this post with the originals.

And again; I don't hate her voiceover and I'm not complaining, I'm giving my criticism towards something that bothers me and takes away from what is, otherwise, a really great achievement by Riot. I actually love the voiceover as a whole (although the actress could've done a better job, but thats beside the point.)

That has absolutely nothing to do with what I said in my comment, but alright.

And making the long move voice lines shorter defeats the purpose of them being long move voice lines. They're _supposed_ to be monologues that give us more information about the character we are playing. The shorter lines are for short moves, attacking, ect.

Does a character need to be talking every minute of the game? 

no, no they do not.

In League, they do, because for many, many players, that is the only way they will ever learn their champion's story.

Just because you don't don't like it doesn't mean its not necessary. I know this may be a tough concept for you to understand, but the world doesn't revolve around you and your opinion.

Again. 

Could say the same thing and tell the same story in 1/3rd of the words. And I mean, yeah a constantly evolving online-based game does revolve around the opinions of its players. 
I've been largely misunderstood in this thread though, so this conversation is going no where and won't be reaching Riot's attention.

The thing is voice lines are an expansion of the lore that sometimes doesn't get fleshed out in the actual lore itself. Hearing it directly from the champion is much more powerful than reading about the whole town they are in for that story. For instance, a short story that is about Vel'koz and Lissandra, [https://universe.leagueoflegends.com/en_us/story/the-eye-in-the-abyss)], really expand on what it means to be an ice born. It shows what's under the ARAM map. The protagonists of the story aren't in game champions. So this story gives you perspective of how Vel'koz and Lissandra interacts in the world of Runeterra, but hearing them talk about their motives, philosophies, and moments in their lives is much more impactful.

Pyke, for instance, talks about an underwater city, which you would never get from the "actual" lore; He is just some spooky spectral from reaper of the harbor in the lore. Pyke shares intimate details of how "the last thing he ever drank was priceless". That is HUGE on an emotional level. We understand that something so simple as a drink is monumental to him. "Work hard and then die.... The other way is worse". Comical, yet it shows where he is in life (death?). He is constantly pushing towards an end goal that we think is crossing off the names on his list of those who betrayed him, but from another voice line he says how "his bosses to need gold" or something along that. Now we know he is an employee of someone, but we don't actually know who.... 

It gives the player a very personal look into the champion they are playing. It gives the player a chance to relate or be intrigued by a champion, which could lead to more exciting gameplay or more "maiming" that champion. In the end, if it really upsets you, then it's easy to tune out or you could turn off VO in the audio setting, but it is a great tool to explore a champions story while still playing the game.
